Safety Management System forms the framework for continuous process safety improvement.  Some of the key components are:
	
-	The Management of Change provisions ensure that the potential safety and health impacts of any change made to process chemicals, technology, or equipment are considered.
-	The Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) provisions serve as a tool to ensure timely evaluation of potential hazards and verification of safeguards, thereby leading to continual improvements in process safety.
-	The Mechanical Integrity provisions ensure that process equipment and instrumentation are designed, constructed, installed and maintained to minimize the risk of hazardous releases, thereby serving as an integral part of the safety program.
-	Incident Investigation procedures are in place to ensure that corrective and/or preventative measures are taken, as applicable, following an incident.  This ensures that process design, operating equipment, and operating and maintenance safe work procedures are evaluated to determine changes needed to prevent recurrence of an incident.
-	Internal and third-party compliance audits will ensure that the level of safety protection at the facility is periodically evaluated for improvements with any action items tracked to completion.
-	An annual dialogue with the Upton County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) will ensure a readiness to respond to potential emergencies, as well as a means to implement improvements as the need develops.

-	Providing automated and manual valves to isolate portions of the process.
-	Installing hydrocarbon gas detectors throughout the gas plant to alarm personnel of a possible explosive atmosphere.
-	Installing fire eye detectors throughout the gas plant to alarm personnel of a possible fire.
-	Installing security lighting to facilitate observation of the facility.
-	Minimizing the possibility of emergencies by manning the facility 24/7/365.
-	Providing an evacuation alarm system in order to safely evacuate the facility during an emergency.
-	Conducting periodic operational rounds to ensure problems are detected and corrected in a timely manner.
	
Five-Year Accident History
No on-site incident resulting in injuries, death or significant property damage or known offsite impacts (such as death, injury, property damage, shelter in place, evacuation, or environmental damage from a regulated substance) has occurred at the facility within the last five years.
	
Emergency Planning and Response Program
The facility will conduct emergency response preparedness activities and coordinate any emergency response actions necessary with the Upton County Local Emergency Planning Committee,  the Upton County Sheriff Department and the Upton County Volunteer Fire Department.  The Plant Supervisor is responsible for coordinating the emergency actions when an incident occurs within the facility.  An emergency response program is in place at the facility which has been coordinated with local officials.  The Benedum Gas Plant is designated as a non-responding stationary source. The emergency planning and response program provides the essential information for effectively protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.

WTG has determined that BGP is classified as a Program Level 3 facility under the RMP regulation because the nearest public receptor is within the worst-case scenario flammable endpoint radius and additionally the facility is subject to the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response
The accidental release prevention and emergency planning and response program in place at the facility include:
-	Operating in compliance with required environmental permits and regulations. 
-	Operating and maintaining assets in such a manner that unintentional releases are minimized.
-	Operating and maintaining assets in such a manner that the small releases associated with normal operation and maintenance will be minimized to the extent possible.
-	Correcting non-compliance found by regular audits of the facility, operator training and intervention.

Introduction and Policies

WTG South Permian Midstream LLC (WTG) is committed to managing all operations in a manner that protects the environment and the health and safety of employees, customers, contractors and the public while complying with applicable laws and regulations.  WTGs management philosophy goals are achieved through the implementation of the Environmental, Health, and Safety Management Systems, by the personal commitments of employees and contractors, and by open communication with employees, customers, neighbors, and regulators.

The purpose of this Risk Management Plan (RMP) is to provide information about operations at the facility, programs to prevent accidental chemical releases, and emergency planning and response in the event an accidental release should occur, the five-year accident history of the facility and continuous improvement efforts to improve safety at the facility.

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances
WTG owns and operates a natural gas processing plant located near Midkiff, Texas.  The Benedum Gas Plant (BGP) compresses and treats natural gas to produce residue gas (methane) and natural gas liquids (NGL).  Gas enters the plant through either a high- or low-pressure inlet system.  Low-pressure gas is compressed and sent through amine treatment to remove hydrogen sulfide and carbon dioxide; the resulting waste gas is burned off using a flare.  Amine-treated gas is then mixed with the high-pressure inlet gas and flows through a molecular sieve gas dehydrator to remove water.  The gas then flows to a cryogenic unit that separates out NGL, which leaves the BGP via pipeline.  The remaining gas is compressed and leaves the plant via pipeline.
